cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Vulnerability: Return of Candiru: 'Devils Tongue'
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: The DevilsTongue malware name are signs of compromise by SOURGUM’s malware given by Microsoft. Microsoft has identified over 100 victims of SOURGUM’s malware, and these victims are as geographically diverse as would be expected when varied government agencies are believed to be selecting the targets. Approximately half of the victims were found in Palestinian Authority, with most of the remaining victims located in Israel, Iran, Lebanon, Yemen, Spain (Catalonia), United Kingdom, Turkey, Armenia, and Singapore

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Return of Candiru: 'Devils Tongue'
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: The DevilsTongue malware name are signs of compromise by SOURGUM’s malware given by Microsoft. Microsoft has identified over 100 victims of SOURGUM’s malware, and these victims are as geographically diverse as would be expected when varied government agencies are believed to be selecting the targets. Approximately half of the victims were found in Palestinian Authority, with most of the remaining victims located in Israel, Iran, Lebanon, Yemen, Spain (Catalonia), United Kingdom, Turkey, Armenia, and Singapore

oval-def:extend_definition.comment: check if it is Windows OS

oval-def:criterion.comment: Check hijacked class ids in registry
SHA-256 value of drivers/HW.sys hash matches with 6a4875ae86131a594019dec4abd46ac6ba47e57a88287b814d07d929858fe3e5 is a good detection of Devils Tongue
Check for DevilsTongue configuration files in C:\Windows\system32\migration\*.dll
Check for DevilsTongue configuration files in C:\Windows\system32\ime\.?\*.dll
Check for DevilsTongue configuration files in C:\Windows\system32\wbem\*.dll
Check for DevilsTongue configuration files in C:\Windows\system32\drivers\*.dll

ind-def:family_test.comment: the installed operating system is part of the Microsoft Windows family

win-def:registry_test.comment: Check hijacked class ids in registry

ind-def:filehash58_test.comment: SHA-256 value of drivers/HW.sys hash matches with 6a4875ae86131a594019dec4abd46ac6ba47e57a88287b814d07d929858fe3e5 is a good detection of Devils Tongue
